The Razerbills

Artists

Who’s played, and who’s playing in the Bingley area?

Here’s an A-Z of artists who have played here or have an upcoming gig.

Amnesia

West Yorkshire based retro covers and party band

Facebook: https://www.neilthomas.co.uk/amnesia.html

Last played on Sat. 23 Sep 2023 at The Brown Cow

Augustin Bousfield

Augustin is from Bradford, UK and has played with Gurgles, Mucky Sailor, Henry Parker, Nope and many others as well as performing as Lord Adonis, and remixing as Tomorrows Dad. He has recently been co-producing Saint Etienne’s latest album. He’s performed improv sound and noise, solo and with others at Bradford’s Threadfest, Fundada Festival in Halifax, Vespertine Festival in York and the launch of the Doctor Who exhibition at the National Science and Media Museum with jazz pianist Matthew Bourne and baritone guitarist Andy Abbott.

Web: https://www.augustinbousfield.com/

Last played on Sat. 22 Apr 2023 at Five Rise Records

Beckie Brill

Hi there! Welcome to a world of covers and originals!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/beckiebrillmusic

Last played on Sat. 24 Jun 2023 at The Fisherman’s Pub

Ben Blue Waters

Solo acoustic slide guitar player and singer, performing blues songs from the 1920’s onwards.

Web: https://www.reverbnation.com/benbluewaters

Last played on Wed. 29 Mar 2023 at Martinez Bingley Wine Shop & Wine Bar

Ben Greenwell

Ben Greenwell is a singer/songwriter, harmonica player and guitarist from Yorkshire. With solid grooves and emotive whaling blues harmonica, Greenwell’s soulful voice takes the listener on a journey as he sings about life, loss, love and truth.

Web: https://www.bengreenwellmusic.co.uk/

Last played on Mon. 06 Nov 2023 at Ryshworth Club

Beyond the C

Last played on Sun. 20 Aug 2023 at Myrtle Park

Billy Billy 5P

Leeds super-group, featuring members of bands you’ve never heard of playing covers of pop songs that

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BillyBilly5P

Bingley Handbell Ringers

Playing on Sun. 03 Dec 2023 at St Wilfrid Church

Bingley Handbell Ringers are based in Church House, Old Main Street , Bingley. We meet at 7pm every Wed evening to practice. We can be booked to perform at your event or venue

Web: https://bingleyhandbells.org.uk/

Bingley Weekender

A four day music festival held in Bingley each year.

Web: https://bingleyweekender.co.uk/

Last played on Thu. 03 Aug 2023 at Bradford And Bingley Rugby Club

Blue Star Tattoo

Classic Rock covers band available for weddings, parties, pubs, clubs, etc

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/bluestartattooband

Last played on Thu. 06 Apr 2023 at The Potting Shed

Brad Mack Music

Playing on Sat. 23 Dec 2023 at The Brown Cow

Singer, guitarist & songwriter

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/bradmackmusic

Last played on Sat. 22 Jul 2023 at The Fisherman’s Pub

Bradford Accordian Band

Bradford Accordion Band (BAB) is a unique and diverse amateur musical group whose mission is to make great music, whilst having lots of fun! We have been established since 1997 and our membership comprises 32 accordion, keyboard, woodwind, strings and percussion players between the ages of 22 and 91.

Web: https://www.bradfordaccordionband.co.uk/

Bradford Concert Band

A concert band that comprises players of woodwind, brass, and percussion that plays a wide range of music including stage, musical, film and television music, arrangements of light popular music, marches, formal overtures, some of our own arrangements and novelty numbers.

Web: https://www.b-c-b.org.uk/

Last played on Sun. 16 Jul 2023 at Myrtle Park

Calm Before The Storm

Bradford based Acoustic Duo. Stan Greenwood & Innis Stiles.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/CalmBeforeTheStorm2023

Last played on Sun. 05 Mar 2023 at Ling Bob

Diamond Dac

Web: http://www.diamonddac.com/

Last played on Wed. 08 Nov 2023 at Martinez Bingley Wine Shop & Wine Bar

Halifax Gilbert and Sullivan Society

The Society formed in 1968 and we gave our first fully staged performance 3 years later. We perform our annual show at Halifax Playhouse, usually at the beginning of November.

Web: https://www.halifaxgands.org.uk/

Martin Plock

Rumour has it, that on his way down from Scotland, Martin Plock wrestled a Lynx. This he did before he swam the Tay, which was flooding & in full flow, Jordan like. His songs are dredged from the lowest regions of the soul, grown on the under belly of the most perplexing thought. Listen and they will tell you what others are failing to explain to you.

Web: https://martinplock.bandcamp.com

Last played on Wed. 26 Apr 2023 at Martinez Bingley Wine Shop & Wine Bar

Get involved

Why not become a member and get involved to make a difference?

Sign up to our mailing list to stay informed about what’s happening.

If you have an idea for music in our town, or you’re already doing something, then we’d love to hear it.
Please contact us and tell us all about it.

Can you help? See our Help Wanted page for more opportunities to get involved.
